strapiPost.title: Used-Vehicle Giant CarMax Eyes Rogers for Next Superstore
strapiPost.content:
CarMax, the nation's largest buyer and seller of used vehicles, is seeking approval to build its first Arkansas superstore location in Rogers.

  • The proposal: The dealer is in conversation with the city planning commission over plans to build a 42,909 sqft building on a 17.4-acre site at 6360 S. Dixieland Rd.
  • Estimates: According to Talk Business & Politics, CarMax typically invests $10-$25m in the development of each store location which will hold 200-400 used vehicles on its lot.

Check out TB&P for more details HERE.
